Class BasicPlaybackAudio

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hotware.hotsound.audio.data.BaseAudio
      • de.hotware.hotsound.audio.data.BasicPlaybackAudio
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAudio, ISeekableAudio, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    WaveAudio

    public class BasicPlaybackAudio
extends BaseAudio
implements ISeekableAudio
    converts to a playable format

    Martin Braun

      • read

        public int read(byte[] pData,
       int pStart,
       int pLength)
         throws IAudio.AudioException
        Description copied from interface: IAudio
        Reads up to a specified maximum number of bytes of data from the audio stream, putting them into the given byte array. This method will always read an integral number of frames. If pLength does not specify an integral number of frames, a maximum of len - (pLength % frameSize) bytes will be read.
        Specified by:
        read in interface IAudio
        Throws:
        IAudio.AudioException
